message_1: Consider the simplicial complex K which is formed by three vertices and three edges that connect them in a triangle. Let us call these vertices v1, v2, and v3, respectively. Determine the number of 2-simplices (triangles) in K.
message_2:
In the simplicial complex K, there are three vertices (v1, v2, and v3) and three edges connecting them in a triangle. A 2-simplex (triangle) is formed by connecting three vertices with three edges.

In this case, there is only one possible 2-simplex (triangle) that can be formed using all three vertices and edges, which is the triangle with vertices v1, v2, and v3.

Therefore, there is only 1 2-simplex (triangle) in the simplicial complex K.
